verses.verse: {The Redemption of Zion} d Awake, awake! Clothe yourself with strength, {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read with your strength} O Zion! Put on your beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city, for the uncircumcised and the unclean won't enter you. {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read you any more}

Shake yourself from the dust and {So 1QIsa a LXX; 4QIsa b MT lack and} arise, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} sit on your throne, O Jerusalem! Loosen the bonds from your neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
For this is what the Lord says: "You were sold for nothing, and you'll be redeemed without money."
For this is what the Lord {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads the Lord God} says: "My people went down long ago into Egypt to live {Or sojourn} there; the Assyrian, too, has oppressed them without cause.

"Now therefore, what {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads who} am I doing here,"asks {Lit. declares} the Lord , "seeing that my people are taken away without cause? Those who rule over them are deluded,"{So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read them wail ; or them taunt} says the Lord , "and continually, all the day long, my name is blasphemed.
Therefore my people will know my name; in that day {So 1QIsa a LXX. MT reads therefore in that day} they'll know that it is I who speaks, «Here I am!'

"How beautiful {Lit. they are beautiful ; so 1QIsa a MTT LXX mss ; 4QIsa b reads It is beautiful} on the mountains are the feet of the one who brings news of peace, {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read who brings good news} who announces good things, who announces salvation, {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads who announces peace, who brings news of good things, who announces salvation ; cf. LXX} who says to Zion, «Your God reigns!'

Listen! Your watchmen lift up their voices, {Lit. their voice ; so 1QIsa a ; MT reads the voice} together they sing for joy; for they will see in plain sight the return of the Lord to Zion with compassion. {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks with compassion}

"Break forth together into singing, {Lit. sing for joy (sing.); so 1QIsa a ; MT reads sing for joy (pl.)} you ruins of Jerusalem; for the Lord has comforted his people, and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks and} he has redeemed Jerusalem.
The Lord has bared his holy arm {I. e. the Messiah} in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our God.
"Depart! Depart! Go out from there; touch no unclean thing; go out from the midst of her; purify yourselves, you who carry the vessels of the Lord .

For you won't go out in haste, nor will you go in flight; for the Lord will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rear guard. He is called the God of all the earth." {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack this line}
{The Suffering Servant} d "Look! My servant will prosper, and {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa c MT lack and ; LXX lacks and he will be exalted} he will be exalted and lifted up, and will be very high.

Just as many were astonished at you {So 1QIsa a MT LXX; MT mss Syriac read at him} so was he marred in {Or was my marring ; so 1QIsa a ; MT reads was the marring of} his appearance, more than any human, and his form beyond that of human semblance {Lit. of the descendants of humans ; so 1QIsa a ; LXX reads of the humans ; MT reads of the human}
so will he startle {Or sprinkle} many nations. Kings will shut their mouths at him; for what had not been told them they will see, and what they had not heard they will understand.
